text: I wonder if LinearAlgebra.eigen (or other names) uses the lanczos algorithm if only a few eigenvalues/eigenvectors are needed. I have a MKL julia 1.5, that appears incompatible with Arpack..

elements.text: I wonder if LinearAlgebra.eigen (or other names) uses the lanczos algorithm if only a few eigenvalues/eigenvectors are needed. I have a MKL julia 1.5, that appears incompatible with Arpack..

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

For example, the following code kills julia MKL:
```using LinearAlgebra
using Arpack
a= Hermitian(rand(10,10))
eigs(a,nev=2)```

elements.text: For example, the following code kills julia MKL:

using LinearAlgebra
using Arpack
a= Hermitian(rand(10,10))
eigs(a,nev=2)

text: It's not the same precision is it?

elements.text: It's not the same precision is it?

text: I would be surprised if arpack was faster for dense matrices

elements.text: I would be surprised if arpack was faster for dense matrices
